S.FORM: Katomireng! Mita’ong.
Nga’ayho singsi.
Kamaro’.
Nga’ayho, pasifana’ ko singsi titaanan to kakaenen no ‘Amis.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的阿美語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say Ami for food.

S.FORM: Mahapinang iso ko nisowalan no singsi haw?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: Singsi, caay ka hapinang ako, liyawen haca a somowal.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: Caay ka tengil ako, nga’ay ta’angayen ko ngiha’ haw?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: Pinengneng itini! Tooren kako a misa’osi.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.

S.FORM: Makapahay ko pisa’osi.
Liyawenho a misa’osi, sa ta’angayen ko ngiha’.
S.TRANSL: Read it again. Please speak louder.

S.FORM: Katomerep, aka caciyaw.
Pasadaken ko cudad.
Hai, singsi.
Pasadaken ko impic iso.
Singsi, matawal ako ko impic.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: Pasadaken ko sasipasip.
Singsi, matawal ako ko sasipasip.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: Caliwen kono tihi iso a sasipasip.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: Nga’ay a pacaliwenho kako to sapisipasip haw?
Maherekto ko pitilid ita.
Tahini aca ko pitilid ita, liyaw sato a lipay a masaso’araw kita.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: Cima kiso?
Ci Laway kako.
Cima kiso?
O wawa ni Laway kako, ci Caki kako.
S.TRANSL: I am the son of Layay, my name is Caki.

S.FORM: Cima kiso?
O mitiliday ni Mayaw kako, ci Kacaw kako.
S.TRANSL: I'm a student in Mayaw, my name is Kacaw.

S.FORM: Cima ko ngangan no miso?
Ci Kacaw kako.
Cima ko ngangan no mama iso?
Ci Lamlo ko ngangan no mama ako.
Cima cingra?
Ci Kolas cingra.
O kaka ako cingra, ci Maysang cingra.
S.TRANSL: He's my brother, his name is Maysang.

S.FORM: Cima ko ngangan ningra?
Ci Sawtoy ko ngangan ningra.
Ci Mayaw ko ngangan ningra haw?
Hai, ci Mayaw ko ngangan ningra.
Ci Mayaw ko ngangan ningra haw?
Caay, ci Kolas ko ngangan ningra.
Cima kora tamdaw?
Ci Panay cingra, o fai ako.
Cima kora tamdaw?
O widang ako cingra, ci Imoy ko ngangan ningra.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Imoy。
She's my friend, her name is Imoy.

S.FORM: Hakowaay ko mihecaan iso anini?
Mo^tepay ko mihecaan ako hatini.
Hakowaay ko mihecaan ningra anini?
Mo^tep ira ko tosa ko mihecaan ningra anini.
Hakowaay to ko mihecaan no mama iso anini?
Lima a polo’ ko mihecaan no wama ako hatini.
Papina kamo a malikaka?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: Ira ko tatosa a kaka ako, cecay ko safa ako.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

S.FORM: Iraay ko kaka iso?
Awaay ko kaka ako.
Papina kamo paro no loma’?
S.TRANSL: How many people are in your family?

S.FORM: Sepatay ko paro no loma’niyam.
Icowaay kiso a mitilid?
I Pusongay kako a mitilid.
Cima cingra?
O faki ako cingra.
O maan ko tayal no faki iso?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: kincac ko mira.
Cima kora tamdaw?
O kaka ako cingra.
Matayalay ko kaka iso?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?

S.FORM: Matayalay i paisingan cingra.
O malikakaay cangra a tatosa haw?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: Caay, o malawidangay cangra.
O Pangcah kiso?
Hai, o ’Amis kako.
O Pangcah ko ramod iso?
Hai, kawrira o Paliwan cingra.
’Akawang ko mama iso?
Hai, ’akawang ko paro no loma’ niyam.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: Mitilidayto ko safa iso haw?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: Hai, mitilidayto.
Mafana’ tono Pangcah a sowal ko safa iso?
S.TRANSL: Do your siblings speak the language?

S.FORM: Hai, mafana’ cangra a sano Pangcah.
S.TRANSL: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

S.FORM: Papina ko salikaka iso?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: Tatolo ko salikaka ako.
S.TRANSL: I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: Malacecay ko aro’ iso to mama ato ina haw?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: Hai, malacecay ko aro’ ako to mama ato ina.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: Malacecay ko aro’ iso to akong ato mamo haw?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: Caay, caay ka lacecay ko aro’ ako i cangraan.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: Cima ko cafay iso a maro’?
Malacecay ko aro’ ako to mama, ina ato kaka .
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.

S.FORM: O nani cowaay kiso a tayni?
O nani Arapawananay kako.
Icowaay ko loma’ namo?
I Poskuay ko loma’ niyam.
Icowaay ko paniyaro’an iso?
I Kalingkoay ko paniyaro’an ako.
Icowaay ko niyaro’ namo?
O Cilamitay ko niyaro’ niyam.
Ano hacowa a minokay kiso a talaniyaro’?
S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: Minokay kako to kaciferangan a pahanhanan.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.

S.FORM: O wawa no ’Amis kako.
Masamaan ko romi’ad anini?
Masadakayto ko cidal, fa^det ko romi’ad.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.

S.FORM: Si^naw i papotal?
S.TRANSL: Is it going to be cold outside?

S.FORM: Si^naw, adihayen ko kaciriko’.
S.TRANSL: It’s cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: Fa^det ko papotal haw?
Caay, mafalito, sa^meray.
Samaan ko romi’ad anini?
Caay ka si^naw, caay ka fa^det, sanga’ay saan.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It’s neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: Masamaan ko romi’ad tona dadaya?
Awaay ko to^em i kakarayan, masadakay ko fo’is.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky, the stars came out.

S.FORM: Masamaan ko romi’ad i papotal?
Terp saho ko ’orad, masadakto ko cidal, madasak ko talakal ni Idek.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: Samaan ko romi’ad i tisowanan?
S.TRANSL: What’s the weather like where you are?

S.FORM: Tata’ang ko pifiyok no fali i tamiyanan.
S.TRANSL: We’re going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: Manga’ay ko romi’ad i tisowanan?
Manga’ayay, tata’ang ko sadak no cidal.
S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.

S.FORM: Mitilid to kako.
S.TRANSL: I have to go to school.

S.FORM: Si^naw ko romi’ad, tongalen ko kaciriko’.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: Masadak to kako talapapotal.
Ma’orad ano sawni, hawikiden ko saong iso.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It’s going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: O mama’orad haw?
Makakeleng i sawni, o mama’orad anosawni.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it’s supposed to rain later.

S.FORM: Ma’oradayto haw?
Ma’oraday i sawni, tomrepto imatini.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it’s stopped.

S.FORM: Ma’oradayto haw?
Mato ma’oraday, masengerho ko lalan.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: Ma’oraday haw? Mana macepa’ ko tireng iso?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: Ma’orad ko papotal, caay pihawikid kako to saong.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It’s raining outside, so I didn’t bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: Manga’ayho kiso?
Tata’ang ko fali, adada ko fongoh ako.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: Manga’ayho kiso?
Tata’ang ko cidal, malileng ko fongoh ako.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

S.FORM: Matawal ako ko impic.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: Pacaliwen ako kiso.
Matawal ako ko ’alapit.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: caay ka pihawikid kako, tata mi’aca kita.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either, let’s go buy one.

S.FORM: Micakay kita to impic haw?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: Nga’ayto, micakay haca kako to sasipasip.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: Micakay kita to sakaranam haw?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go get breakfast, shall we?

S.FORM: Na’ay, komaenayto kako i loma’.
S.TRANSL: No, I’ve already eaten at home.

S.FORM: Matawal ako a mifa^det ko tafo.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

S.FORM: Kalamkamen a mipafa^det.
Matawal ako ko a mihawikid ko tafo.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: Lacecay sa kita a komaen to tafo ako.
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let’s eat my lunch box together!

S.FORM: O maan ko sakalahok iso?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: Komaen kako tono pitilidan a sakalahok.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.

S.FORM: O maan ko kakaenen iso to kalahokan?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: Mihawikid kako to tafo anini, lacecay sa kita a malahok.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I’ve brought a lunchbox today, let’s eat together at noon!

S.FORM: Nga’ay kita a mimali haw?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: Manga’ay! Tata tayra kita.
Miyakiw kita haw?
Na’ay, mitilid kako.
Padangen kako a miala to saasik.
S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: Hai, pafelien ako kiso tona saasik.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here’s a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: Patadoen kako a miala to sasifin.
S.TRANSL: Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: Miasiaky kako, papialaen iso ci Kacaw.
S.TRANSL: I’m sweeping the floor and you asked Kacaw to carry it for you.

S.FORM: Maherekto kiso a miasik?
Maherekayto kako.
Naw capiasik kiso?
Maherekayto kako a miasik.
Makadit ko pa^nan, sisitenho.
S.TRANSL: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: Hai, miala kako to kiradom.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go get the cloth.

S.FORM: Makadit ko palatawan, sifinenho.
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: Akaho, caayho ka asik ako itini.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I’m not done sweeping here yet.

S.FORM: Nimaan kiso anosawni?
Mikilim kako to singsi.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: Maherek a mitilid nimaan kiso?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: Romadiw kako ato widang.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: Maherek mitilid, nimaan cingra?
Midangoy cingra.
Iraay ci Aso i loma’ haw?
S.TRANSL: May I ask if Aso is home?

S.FORM: Iraay i loma’ cingra, ka picomod.
S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: Iraay ci Hana haw?
S.TRANSL: May I ask if Hana is home?

S.FORM: Awaay cingra, o maan ko salicay no miso saw?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: Cima saw?
Akong, ci Sonay kako, fohatenho ko fawahan.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, this is Sonay, please open the door.

S.FORM: O cima kiso saw?
Kacaw, ci Mayaw kako, tayni kako i tisowanan a misalama.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw, I’m Mayaw, I’ve come to play with you.

S.FORM: ’Alafinto a caka saso’araw kita.
Hai, tada ma’ilol tisowanan, katayni a miholol.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!

S.FORM: Kamaro’, pinanom to ociya.
S.TRANSL: Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: Ahowiday.
Pinanom to ociya.
Wata! manga’ay a nanomen ko ociya namo.
Kakomaen kita to heci no losay.
Hai, mato nga’ayay kona heci no losay.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: Nga’ay a kaenen ko heci no losay haw?
Hai, so’lin a nga’ay a kaenen.
Maherekto misakalafi ci ina, katayni a komen.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

S.FORM: Hai, monanaw kako to kamay.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: Halikaenen, o tao kiso a mimaan.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

S.FORM: Adihay ko nikaenan ako, mafecolayto.
S.TRANSL: I ate a lot, I’m full.

S.FORM: Adihayen ko nikaenan, aka ka ngodo.
Hai, nga’ay a kaenen.
Miliyasto kako, liyaw tayni sato kako a miliso’ tisowan.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

S.FORM: Hayda, nanay masaso’arawho kia.
To^manto, minokayto kako.
Miliyaw tayni sato a misalama.
Na’onen ko rakat.
Hai, cilimaw tayni i loma’ ako a misalama.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: Nga’ayho kita mapolong, keriden no singsi kita anini a miliso’ to kalas no niyaro’.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: Tada manga’ay! Sano ’Amisen ita ko mato’asay.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說阿美語。

S.FORM: Mangatato a tahira kita haw?
Mangatato.
Akong, miliso’ kami i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: Mafana’ kamo tono ’Amis a caciyaw. A! tadamanga’ay.
S.TRANSL: 你們會說阿美語啊!真是太棒了!

S.FORM: Nga’ayho kita mapolong, keriden no singsi kita anini a tayra i pisalamloan a omah.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: Hai, singsi.
Pisarayarayto kita, haratengen ko hahawikiden a sakatayal.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: Hai, singsi, matatoyto niyam ko sakatayal.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.

S.FORM: Maraodayto ita haw?
Caayho, maraayayho.
S.TRANSL: Not yet, it’s still far away.

S.FORM: Picefos kiso.
Hai, micefos kako.
Piala kiso to salaplap to ’ayam.
S.TRANSL: You go get the bird catcher.

S.FORM: Hai, milaplap kako to ’ayam.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: Nga’ayho kita mapolong, tayra kita i pa^coan anini.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: Tadamanga’ay! Maanen ita a tayra?
S.TRANSL: 好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: Midakaw kita to paso.
Misarayaray kita, mami’aca kita to paya.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: Hai.
O pa’ayaman koni ka’ayaway, o pa’onelan kona ’aikoray, paytemek han ita a minengen.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

S.FORM: Singsi matalaw kako to ’onel.
Mamaan aca, ka pinengen kiso to ’ayam.
S.TRANSL: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: I ikor no cecay a tatokian i, patikor kita a masa’opo.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: Hai, aray singsi.
O maan ko ma’araw iso anini ?
Ma’araw ako ko adihayaya a ’onel, iraho ko adihayay a ’ayam.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.

S.FORM: Kalamkamen, lomowadto kita.
S.TRANSL: Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: Talaen kako, rarima ko wa’ay ako.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: Malahakelong kita a midangoy haw?
Hayda! Tata.
’Aloman ko tamdaw a midangoy itini.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: Talolong ko nanom itira, itini to kita a midangoy.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

S.FORM: O maan ko saka tayni iso?
Romakat kako a tayni.
O maan ko pikalican iso a tayni?
Pakapaso kako a tayni.
Maanen iso a tayra i kiwkay?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to church?

S.FORM: Padakawen no mama to tosiya kako a malacecay a tayra.
Maanen ningra a tala pitilidan to hatiniay?
S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: Midakaw cingra to ciyon a tayra pitilidan.
S.TRANSL: He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: Maanen no mamo iso a micakay to dateng?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

S.FORM: Pakaotopay cingra a micakay to dateng.
S.TRANSL: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

S.FORM: Maanen iso a tayra i Fotod?
S.TRANSL: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: Pakatamina kako a tayra i Fotod.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

S.FORM: Pakamaan cingra a tayra i Fotod?
S.TRANSL: How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: Pakahikoki cingra a tayra i Fotod.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: O maan ko midakawan ningra a tayra i Takaw?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: Pakakawtiy cingra a tayra i Takaw.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: Pakacinamalay cingra a tayra i Pusong haw?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: Hai, pakacinamalay cingra a tayra i Pusong.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: Pakacinamalay cingra a tayra i Pusong haw?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: Caay, pakahikoki cingra a tayra i Pusong.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: I ngata noni, iraay ko pidakawan to paso a siyataw haw?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: Iraay, tala’ayaw han ko rakat, ma’arawto ko saytaw no paso.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: Icowaay ko sangataay a siyataw no ciyon itini?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: Awaay ko siyataw no ciyon itini, deng pipakahayya iso.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: Midakaw to paso, hakowa ko halafin tahira i pitilidan?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: Safaw lima a fen tahira to i pitilidan.
Pakakawtiy hakowa ko halafin tahira to i Tayciw?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

S.FORM: Cecay a tatokian tahira to i Tayciw.
S.TRANSL: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: Pakapaliding hakowa ko halafin a tahira i Olay?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: Latek cecay ko tatokian.
Pakaciyon kiso a tayni i loma’ ako, hakowa ko halafin?
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

S.FORM: Pakaala to tosa polo’ a fen.
Mafana’ kiso a mikoliciw haw?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: Mafana’ kako a mikoliciw.
Iraay ko otopay iso haw?
Iraay ko cecay a otopay ako.
Iraay ko otopay iso haw?
Awaay ko otopay ako.
Manga’ay kako a milicay tisowan haw?
Manga’ayto, mangalayay kako.
Manga’ay kako a milicay tisowan haw?
Na’ay, caay kahakowa ko kafana’an ako.
S.TRANSL: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

S.FORM: Cilimaw kiso to herek no lahok haw? manga’ay a liso’en ako kiso?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: Nga’ayto, talaen ako kiso i loma’.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: Cilimaw kiso ano papacem haw? Sapilicayan kako to pakayniay tono to’asan a kitoh no ‘Amis.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於阿美族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legendary story of the Amis.

S.FORM: Talalotok kako anopapacem, awa kako i loma’.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

S.FORM: Mafana’ kiso to pinangan no rayray no ’Amis, saan ko katengilan ako, saka sapilicayan kako i tisowananan.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對阿美族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you know a lot about Amis traditions and customs, so I would like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: Caay ka hakowa ko kafana’an ako, kawrira paca’of han ako ko licay iso.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: Manga’ay kako a misasing to dademakay a sasing haw? O saka narikayaw a pakaharateng to ikor.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: Nga’ayto, mamaan aca saw.
Hakowaayto ko mihecaan iso?
Siwaayto a polo’ ira ko falo ko mihecaan ako.
Masaka^mangho kiso.
Cakira, malitengto kako.
O nanicowaay kiso?
O nani Fata’ananay kako.
S.TRANSL: I’m from [Matthew’s Saddle]. *Please change [Matthew Saddle] to an ethnic location.

S.FORM: O ’Amis ko fafahi iso?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是阿美族人嗎?

S.FORM: Caay, o Piyuma cingra.
Mafana’ kiso a caciyaw to romaroma a sowal haw?
Mafana’ kako a somowal to no ’Amis ato no Piyuma.
S.TRANSL: 我會說阿美語和卑南語。
I can speak Ami and Puyuma.

S.FORM: Malipahak ko faloco’ a miliso’ i tisowan, o maan ko kapaysinan no mi’adopay?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: Nga’ay to, yo kapahho kako, mararid kako a talalotok a mi’adop.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: Aray tisowanan, tadamanga’ay ko pipakafana’ iso anini a romi’ad.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: Sahto o so’linay koni sowalan ako, mahaen ko kitoh no tato’asan.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: Tahini ko kalaholol ita, tadamiahowid to pipalada’ iso.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: Aka ka ngodo, liyaw sato a malaholol haca kita.
Miliyasto kako, nanay miliyaw a pakatengilho to adihayay a kitoh.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

S.FORM: Nga’ayto! Na’onen ko rakat.
Nga’ayho, o maan ko ’a’acaen iso?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what do you want to buy?

S.FORM: Mi’aca kako to cecay a ko^epo.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a cup.

S.FORM: Nga’ayho, o maan ko ’a’acaen iso?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what are you looking for?

S.FORM: Mi’aca kako to cecay a kafong.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: Mi’aca kako to ko^epo, mipacakayay kamo haw?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

S.FORM: Iraay, pina ko ’acaen iso?
S.TRANSL: Yes, how many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: Mipacakayay kamo to ’icep haw?
Caay, caay ka pa’aca kami to ’icep.
S.TRANSL: No, we don't sell betel nut.

S.FORM: Mi’aca kako to felac.
Pina a lofoc ko ’a’acaen iso?
S.TRANSL: How many packs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: Pafelien kako to tolo a lofoc.
Mi’aca kako to konga.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Ma^eminayto a mapacakay ko konga.
S.TRANSL: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

S.FORM: Mi’aca kako to tosa talid a simal.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

S.FORM: Deng cecay to a talid kami.
S.TRANSL: We only have one bottle left.

S.FORM: Padangenho kako a mi’aca to fita’ol.
Pina a tingting ko ’acaen iso?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds do you want to buy?

S.FORM: Pina a tingting ko ’acaen iso a fita’ol?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: Tosa a tingting ko ’a’acaen ako.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: Mi’aca kako to tosa lolong a kenaw.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: Toloayto a lolong itini, ^min hanto a pafeli kiso.
S.TRANSL: There are three left, you can have them all!

S.FORM: Pina ko ’aca no cecay lofoc a felac?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: Tosa so’ot a limood ko cecay lofoc.
Polong i tosapolo’ ira ko cecay, tosa aca a polo’ nga’ayto.
Ahowiday.
Siwa a polo’ ira ko lima a limood koni.
Mi’acaho kako to miming, ta matatodong somo’ot a limood.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: polong i lima so’ot ira ko mo^tep a limood.
Limaen aca a so’ot, nga’ay haw?
Matekes konini, nga’ay saka^meden haw?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

S.FORM: Caay, o sa ka^medayto konini.
S.TRANSL: 不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.

S.FORM: Mangalay kako tonini a sinpi.
S.TRANSL: I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: Tolo polo’ limood konini a sinpi, o romaho a maan ko ’a’a caen iso?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

S.FORM: Manga’ay kako a micaliw to payso iso haw?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: Nga’ayto, pina ko caliwen iso saw?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: Matawal ako a mihawikid ko payso, nga’ay a pacaliw to payso iso haw?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: Caay ka pihawikid kako to payso.
S.TRANSL: I don't have any money either!

S.FORM: Matawal ako a mihawikid ko payso, nga’ay a pacaliw to payso iso haw?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: Na’ay, caayho ka patikor kiso toya i ’ayaway a payso.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: Manga’ay kako a micaliw to riko’ iso haw?
Nga’ayto, ala han iso.
Manga’ay kako a micaliw to cudad iso haw?
Mapacaliwto ako ci Osay.
Manga’ay a pacaliwen kako to koliciw iso haw?
S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: Nga’ay to, kawrira patikoren kako anopapacem.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: Ma’oradto, capihawikid kako to saong, nga’ay a pacaliw takowan to saong haw?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me one?

S.FORM: Cecay ko saong ako, lacecay sa kita a misasaong.
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

S.FORM: Oya mipacaliwan iso i’ayaw i takowan a cudad koni, patikoren ako kiso.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: O maanho ko nanengnengen iso a cudad, pasowal han kako.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: Ano hacowa a patikoren ako kiso to payso saw?
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: Mimaan saw, ira sato ko payso iso, itiya hanto.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: Ano hacowa a patikor kiso to payso i takowan saw?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?

S.FORM: Patikor hanto ako kiso anopapacem.
S.TRANSL: I'll return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: Ano hacowa a patikor kiso to cudad i takowan saw?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?

S.FORM: Mapatikorto ako inacila kiso kiyami?
S.TRANSL: 我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: O nipacaliwan ni Kacaw i tisowanan a impic koninian haw?
S.TRANSL: Did Kacaw lend you this pen?

S.FORM: Hai, o micaliwan ako anini i cingraan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: O nicaliwan iso ci Kacawan a impic koninian haw?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Kacaw?

S.FORM: Caay, o mi’acan no ina ako konini.
S.TRANSL: No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: Awaayto ko cinah, picaliw to cinah ci Panayan.
S.TRANSL: We're out of salt, go borrow some from Panay.

S.FORM: Hayda, tayra kako a micaliw.
Papipatikoren itakowanan to payso ci Panay.
S.TRANSL: Go tell Panay to pay me back.

S.FORM: Pina ko tadah ningra i tisowanan saw?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: Talacowa kiso?
Tayra kako i palafalan a paloma to dateng.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: Nimaanay kiso?
Adihay ko rengos, mifariw kako, micefos kako anosawni.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

S.FORM: Nga’ay a pataynien takowanan ko kawkaw ato pitaw haw?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

S.FORM: Icowaan iso a pateli?
I tatihi no sasenat.
S.TRANSL: Put it next to the plow rake.

S.FORM: Mafelihayto iso ko sota’?
S.TRANSL: Did you turn over the soil?

S.FORM: Mafelihayto ako isawni, o mamifolsak kako anosawni.
S.TRANSL: 我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: Ma^dengayto a lodoten ko dateng iso haw?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: Nga’ayto a lodoten ko tamana, caayho ka nga’ay a lodoteng ko hedot.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的昭和草就還不能收成。
The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

S.FORM: Wa! Adihay ko malongaday iso a konga.
S.TRANSL: 哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
(sighs) Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: Nga’ay a mipadang takowan a pateli i ’alili haw?
S.TRANSL: Will you help me with the barn?

S.FORM: Nimaanay kamo?
Mipasalilay kami a mifoting.
S.TRANSL: We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

S.FORM: Adihay ko foting itini?
Matomesto i kalawad ko foting.
S.TRANSL: 魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.

S.FORM: Samaan ko pifoting iso to hatiniay?
S.TRANSL: How do you usually catch fish?

S.FORM: O capa’ ko sapitesek ako to foting.
S.TRANSL: I shoot fish with a spear.

S.FORM: Mafana’ kiso a mipana’ to a’adopen?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: O talakal ko sapi’adop ako, roma i mitatoy kako to kowang, ira ko waco a mi’adop.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

S.FORM: O narakatan no fafoy konini a lalan.
S.TRANSL: This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: Na mafana’ kiso?
O saripa’ no fafoy konini, saka o rarakaten no fafoy koni a lalan.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: Tata nengeng ita ko tekel ita, matiya ci tama’ayto.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: Naw mafana’ kiso?
Mato masanekay no waco, tata kalamkamen ita a mitoor.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

S.FORM: O maan ko nisanga’an iso imatini?
S.TRANSL: 你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: O mipaekelan to fakloh a talakal konini, o sapilepet to molafaw.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

S.FORM: O maan ko nitelian iso itira?
S.TRANSL: 你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: O cisafaloday to o’o a talakal, o sapitalakal niyam to mancel .
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: Tada miaray to palemed no to’as, adihay ko tama’ niyam anini a romi’ad.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: Hai, panokayen ita konini to sapalada’ to niyaro’.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: Pakafana’en no singsi kamo to ngangan no pinanowang anini.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的阿美語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Pangcah language today.

S.FORM: Pakafana’en no singsi kamo to ngangan no pinalengaw anini.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的阿美語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of plants in Pangcah language today.

S.FORM: Pakafana’en no singsi kamo to ngangan no heci no losay anini.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的阿美語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Pangcah language today.

S.FORM: Aka kafoti’!
Aka kacaciyaw!
Aka kakomaen to kakaenen!
Sadaken ko tilid no miso.
Sadaken ko impic no miso.
Sadaken ko tatiliden no miso.
Solimeten ko tilid.
Solimeten ko impic.
Solimeten ko kakaenen.
Solimeten ko tasalamaen.
O nima a impic koni?
O no mako.
O nima a tilid koni?
Ni Dawa.
O nima a sasipasip koni?
Hayken. Cowa kafana’ kako.
O riko’ ni Tomon kora haw?
Cowa, o riko’ ni Panay koni.
Singsi, cowa kaala ako ko tilid.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

S.FORM: Lacafay sa to katihiay a kapot minengneng.
S.TRANSL: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

S.FORM: Mapitekay ko impic no mako.
Caliwen ko impic no kapot.
O yencepi ko sapisorit.
Masidayay ko sasipasip no mako.
Pacaliwen no mako kiso to sasipasip ako.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: Pahanhan to kita mitilid, tayoen ko rakat a minokay!
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心!
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

S.FORM: Hay. Ahowiday singsi.
Pahanhan to kita mitilid, ’arayom!
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，大家再見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: ’Arayom singsi.
Nga’ay ho kita, ci Kanas ko ngangan ako.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Kanas.

S.FORM: Kanas, nga’ay ho!
Nga’ay ho kita a maemin! Ci Kolas ko ngangan ako.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Kolas.

S.FORM: Kolas, nga’ay ho!
Nga’ay ho, ci Mayaw kako.
Mayaw, nga’ay ho! Ci Calaw kako.
Nga’ay ho, ci Sinto kako.
Sinto, nga’ay ho! Ci Anay kako.
Cima kiso?
O ina ni Talo kako, ci Dakoc ko ngangan no mako.
Cima kiso?
O safa ni Talo kako, ci Arik ko ngangan no mako.
S.TRANSL: 我是Talo的妹妹，我的名字是Arik。
I am Isin’s sister. My name is Aing.

S.FORM: Cima cira?
O singsi ako cira, ci Takaki cira.
Cima kora tamdaw?
O kaka ako cira, ci Ngayaw ko ngangan nira.
Ci Kanas cira haw?
Hay, ci Kanas cira.
Ci Kanas kiso haw?
Cowa, ci Mayaw kako.
Cima ci Mayaw?
Kako, ci Mayaw kako.
Cima ci Calaw?
O idang ako ci Calaw.
Cima ko ngangan no kaka iso to fafahiyan?
S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: Ci Hongay ko ngangan no kaka ako to fafahiyan.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister’s name is Hongay.

S.FORM: Cima ko ngangan no safa iso to fafahiyan?
S.TRANSL: What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: Ci Miko ko ngangan no safa ako to fafahiyan.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister’s name is Miko.

S.FORM: Mafana’ay kiso to ngangan nira haw?
Ci Mayaw ko ngangan nira.
Pina to ko mihecaan no kaka iso to fa’inayan anini?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: Moetep ira ko lima ko mihecaan nira anini.
Pina to ko mihecaan no safa iso to fa’inayan anini?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: Lima to ko mihecaan nira anini.
Iraay ko kongkoan i niyaro’ namo haw?
S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: Iraay.
Itiraay kiso i kongkoan no niyaro’ a mitilid haw?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: Hai, malecad to loma’ay ko pitilid i kongkoan.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

S.FORM: Cima kora fa’inayan?
O faki ako cira.
Cima kora fafahiyan?
O fafahiyan a kaka ako cira.
Cima kora wawa?
O fa’inayan a safa ako cira.
O mimaanay ko tayal no ina iso?
S.TRANSL: 你的媽媽從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: O sofitay cira.
O mimaanay ko tayal no ama iso?
S.TRANSL: 你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: O singsi cira.
O safa iso cira haw?
Cowa, o idang no safa ako cira.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

S.FORM: O kaka iso cira haw?
Cowa, o safa ako cira.
S.TRANSL: No, she is my younger sister.

S.FORM: Papinaay ko paro no loma’ nangra?
S.TRANSL: How many people in their family?

S.FORM: Lalimaay ko paro loma’ nangra.
S.TRANSL: There are five people in their family.

S.FORM: Papinaay ko wawa no loma’ namo?
S.TRANSL: How many children in your family?

S.FORM: Sasepatay kami o wawa.
S.TRANSL: There are four children in our family.

S.FORM: Papinaay ko safa iso?
S.TRANSL: How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: Tatoloay ko safa ako, saheto o fafahiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

S.FORM: Papinaay ko kaka iso?
S.TRANSL: How many older siblings do you have?\nI don’t have any older siblings.

S.FORM: Awaay ko kaka ako.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any older siblings.

S.FORM: Papinaay ko salikaka iso?
S.TRANSL: How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: Awaay ko salikaka ako.
Malikakaay kamo haw?
Hay, o kaka ako cira.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he is my brother.Are you brothers?

S.FORM: O Yencomin kamo haw?
Hay, o Yencomin kami.
O ’Amis ko mira haw?
Hay, o ’Amis cira.
Samaanay ko romi’ad anini?
Sienaway ko romi’ad, adihayen ko ninanoman to faedetay a nanom.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: Samaanay ko romi’ad anini?
Faedetay ko romi’ad, adihayen ko ninanoman a nanom.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: Samaanay ko romi’ad i papotal?
Ta’angay ko cidal, aka ca pikilidong.
S.TRANSL: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: Samaanay ko romi’ad i papotal?
Mato’emay, cowa kacidal ko romi’ad.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: Masamaan ko romi’ad anocila?
Cowa ko mamacidal anocila, mato’emay ta’angayay ko fali.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

S.FORM: Samaanay ko romi’ad toya romi’ad?
S.TRANSL: How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: Sienaway ko romi’ad, kacikafang a masadak.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

S.FORM: Samaanay ko romi’ad i pa’aliwacan?
S.TRANSL: How’s the weather on the weekend?

S.FORM: Nga’ayay ko romi’ad i pa’aliwacan.
S.TRANSL: It will be sunny on the weekend.

S.FORM: Mama’orad toya romi’ad haw?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: Nga’ay ko romi’ad toya romi’ad, cowa ko mama’orad.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

S.FORM: O mama’orad toya romi’ad haw?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: Hai, o mama’orad ko romi’ad toya romi’ad.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

S.FORM: Ma’oraday hatini haw?
Tomerepay ko ’orad, mahadakay to ko cidal.
S.TRANSL: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: Ma’oraday hatini haw?
Ma’oraday to, cowa kasidinay kako.
S.TRANSL: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: Ma’oraday i papotal haw?
Cowa ka’orad no hatini, mama’orad i ikor no lahok, sidinay to ano mahadak.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: Wa sienaw haw i kasienawan no lalomihecaan?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: Hai, wa sienaw i kasienawan no lalomihecaan, adihayen ko nicaedongan a riko’.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: Anini a mihecaan wa faedet i laloodan haw?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: Hai, wa faedet i laloodan, adihayen ko ninanoman.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: Maolahay kiso to kacanglahan?
Maolahay kako to kacanglahan, dihekoay ko romi’ad.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: Maolahay kiso to kafalawfawan haw?
Cowa kaolah kako to kafalawfawan, adihayay ko faliyos i kafalawfawan.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

S.FORM: Matawalay ako a miala ko tilid.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the textbook.

S.FORM: Hacafayen ako kiso a minengneng.
S.TRANSL: I will share it with you.

S.FORM: Matawalay ako a miala ko sasipasip.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the eraser.

S.FORM: Pacaliwen ako kiso.
Matawalay iso a miala ko impic?
S.TRANSL: Do you forget to bring your pen?

S.FORM: Hai, pacaliwen ho kako to impic iso makena?
S.TRANSL: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

S.FORM: O maan ko kakaenen iso a sakalahok?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for lunch?

S.FORM: Komaen kako to epang.
O maan ko kakaenen iso a sakalafi?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for dinner?

S.FORM: Komaen kako to hemay.
O maan ko nikaenan iso a sakaranam?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for breakfast?

S.FORM: O fita’ol ko nikaenan ako.
O maan ko nikaenan iso a sakalahok?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: O koko’ ko nikaenan ako.
Tata, mitenok kita to mali.
’Ayaw to kiso, sawni to kako tayra mikilim tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.

S.FORM: Tata, midangoy kita.
Hayda! malacafay kita a tayra.
Tata misalama kita to mali.
Aka ho, micolo’ ho kita to tilid.
S.TRANSL: No, we have to carry books first.

S.FORM: Misolacay to kiso to wadis haw?
Cowa ho, mifanaway ho kako to kaysing no hatini.
S.TRANSL: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

S.FORM: Mioraoray to kiso to ngoyos haw?
S.TRANSL: Did you rinse out your mouth?

S.FORM: Mioraoray to kako to ngoyos.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

S.FORM: Mifanaway to kiso to kaysing haw?
Maharekay to kako a mifanaw to kaysing.
Mana ca pisawsaw kiso to kamay?
S.TRANSL: Why didn’t you wash your hands?

S.FORM: Sawni to kako a misawsaw.
S.TRANSL: I will wash my hands later.

S.FORM: Mimaanay kiso i sawni?
S.TRANSL: What were you doing just now?

S.FORM: Mikilimay kako to singsi.
S.TRANSL: I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: Pahanhan to mitilid mamimaan kiso?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: Tedac sa kako a minokay.
Pahanhan to mitilid mamimaan cira?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?

S.FORM: Mamakero cira.
S.TRANSL: She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: Hongay, iraay kiso i loma’ haw?
Iraay. Micomod.
Hongay, iraay kiso i loma’ haw?
Awaay i loma’ ci Hongay! Ci Dakoc kako, mimaan saw? Minokay to ci Hongay, sowal han to ako.
S.TRANSL: Hongay不在家耶!我是Dakoc，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告Hongay。
Hongay is not at home. I am Dakoc. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: Cima kamo?
Fofo, ci Hongay aci Dakoc kami, fawahen ho ko loma’!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是Hongay和Dakoc，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are Hongay and Dakoc, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: Cima saw?
Ci Kolas kako, mikilimay kako ci Taloan.
S.TRANSL: I am Kolas, I am here for Talo.

S.FORM: Fofo, tayniay to kako miliso’ tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: Wata kahalafin to ca ka tayni kiso, ma’ilol to kako tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: Hongay, tayniay to kako, misalama kita.
S.TRANSL: Hongay, I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: Micomod, halafin to ko pitala no mako tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: O nipalomaan ako a konga koni, tanamen a komaen!
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

S.FORM: Sakoesan sa a kaenen kona konga.
S.TRANSL: The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: Katayni ho! O nipalomaan ako a losay koni, tanamen a komaen.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: Sakoesan sa a kaenen kona losay.
Kamaro’ ho! O nipalomaan ako a ’ariray koni to cowa kasiwtoken, tanamen a komaen!
S.TRANSL: 請坐! 這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

S.FORM: Em! Sakoesan sa a kaenen.
S.TRANSL: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: Komaen kiso to ’asiro haw?
Ca kanga’ay kako komaen to ’asiro, o lingko sa ko kaenen no mako.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

S.FORM: Komaen kiso to ’odax haw?
Hai, maolahay kako.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: Podacen no mako ko losay to hakakaenen no miso.
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.

S.FORM: Ahowiday, makasalang kona losay.
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

S.FORM: Pananomen ako kiso.
S.TRANSL: I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: Ahowiday.
Adihayen ko nikaenan, adihay ko nisafelan ako a dateng.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: Em! fangsis sanay, ’adetay a kaenen.
S.TRANSL: 嗚! 真的很香也好吃。
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

S.FORM: Adihayen ko nikaenan, adihayay ho ini.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

S.FORM: Ca to kangodo ako yo!
S.TRANSL: I’ll make myself at home then.

S.FORM: Adihayen ko nikaenan, adihayay ho ini.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: Adihayay to ko nikaenan no mako, ca to kanga’ay a komaen.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: Kakeriden no singsi kamo a tayra i lotok anini.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: Adihayay ko likes i lotok saan ci ina.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: Kakeriden no singsi kamo a tayra i omah anini.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.

S.FORM: Mamikarkar kita to sera haw?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: Tatalacowa kita anini?
Kakeriden no singsi kita tayra i ’alo.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: Tatalacowa kita anini?
Kakeriden no singsi kita a tayra i lotok.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

S.FORM: Tatayra kita i ’alo anini haw?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: Cowa, kakeliden no singsi kita tayra i tokos.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

S.FORM: Tatayra kita i tokos anini haw?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the mountains today?

S.FORM: Cowa, tatayra kita i omah anini.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: Singsi, o maan ko nanengnengen no mita i ’alo?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?

S.FORM: Minengnenng kita to tompo.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: Singsi, o maan ko nanengnengen no mita i tokos?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

S.FORM: Minengnenng kita to ’adipangpang.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: Singsi, mimaan kita tayra i omah?
S.TRANSL: What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: Maminengneng kita toya nipalomaan no mita a ’ariray, na’onen yo adihayay ko kakonah ato fitengal.
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: Singsi, tatayra kita i ’alo a midangoy haw?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: Cowa, maminengneng to kita tompo.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: Singsi, papaloma kita to dateng i omah haw?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

S.FORM: Mamikarkar kita to sera anini.
S.TRANSL: We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: Iraay ko misaefeeferay a tompo i tira.
Anini paka’araw kako to ma’oripay a tompo.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: Iraay ko misaefeeferay a ’adipangpang i tira.
Yey! Wa! Maolahay kako to’adipangpang, makapahay.
S.TRANSL: 耶! 哇! 我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: Iraay ko misaefeeferay a ’adipangpang i tira.
Cowa ko ’adipangpang kora, o fitengal kora.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: Itini to a minengneng, aka ka tayra i raay a pala yo!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: Hai, cowa ko tatayra i raay kami.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: Aka a kacomikay, tayoen ko rakat mapolinaw.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

S.FORM: Halikien ako nga manengneng sanay kako.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: Pakamaan kiso a tayra i talo’an?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: Pakapaliding kako a tayra i talo’an.
Pakamaan cira a tayra i paisingan?
S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: Rakat sanay cira tayra i paisingan.
Pakamaan kiso a tayra i Pongho?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: Pakahikoki kako tayra i Pongho.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: Pakamaan kiso a tayra i Pongho?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: Pakatamina kako tayra i Pongho.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: Pakamaan kiso a minokay?
Pakaci^in kako minokay.
Pakamaan ci Panay a talakongkoan?
S.TRANSL: How does Panay go to school?

S.FORM: Pakasi’acefelay ci Panay a talakongkoan.
S.TRANSL: Panay goes to school by train.

S.FORM: Pakamaan ci Kacaw a talakiwkay?
S.TRANSL: How does Kacaw go to church?

S.FORM: Sitingsa sanay ci Kacaw a talakiwkay.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: Pakaci^in kiso a talakongkoan haw?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: Cowa, pakapaso kako a talakongkoan.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: Pakatingsa kiso a talakongkoan haw?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: Hai, pakatingsa kako a talakongkoan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: PakaKawti kiso a talaTakaw?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: Hai, pakaKawti kako a talaTakaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: O si’acefelay anca o hikoki ko nikalican iso a talaPosong?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: O hikoki ko nikalican ako, kalikiay ko hikoki to si’acefelay.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: Pakapaso anca pakapaliding kiso a talakiwkay?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: Pakapaliding kako talakiwkay, pakapaliding ko madepocay to pakapaso.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: Mangataay ko loma’ namo to cifa haw?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: Cowa kangata, siotofayay kako a talacifa.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去市場。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: Mangataay ko yofing to kongkoan haw?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?

S.FORM: Mangataay, rakat sa tahiraay to.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: Mangataay no siyataw ko kakomaenan haw?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: Mahadak i siyataw lima a fon ko karomakat tahiraay to.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.FORM: Ira ko romi’ad iso anini?
Mimaan?
Sapiliso’an kako tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: Ira ko tayal anini, cowa kailoma’ kako, cila to.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家。改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: Anocila i, ira ko romi’ad iso? Herek no lahok tayra kako tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: Nga’ay to, talaen ako kiso i loma’.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: Nga’ay loingen ako ko caciyaw ita haw? O mamikirok kako.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: Hayda! Nga’ay to.
Nga’ay loingen haw?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: Cowa kakapah kako, o kofaw han aca ca ho kasolimeten, aka to hena.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

S.FORM: Ano hatira i, sasing han no mako.
S.TRANSL: Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: Aka to sasingen.
Ahowiday to pihayda no miso to pihomong i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: Nga’ay to, o maan ko lalicayen iso?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: Licayayaw ho, o mamaanay ko tayal iso yo kapah ho kiso?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: Itiya ho malakincacay kako, mitoysiway to kako no hatini.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.

S.FORM: O maan ko tayal iso hatini?
S.TRANSL: Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: I kongkoan kako matayal.
Iniyaro’ay ko aro’ no wawa iso haw?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: Cowa, itiniay i tokay ko aro’ no wawa ako.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.

S.FORM: Cecayay kiso a mikiloma’ haw?
S.TRANSL: Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: Ira ko cecay to nipariri’an ako a waco ato cecay a ’ayam, todong to o tamdaw to no loma’ ako.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: Pariri’ay kako to cecay a posi, ira ko pinanowang pacafay hay ca kalaholac ko ’orip.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: Licayaw ho ako kiso to kapaysinan no mi’adopay a demak.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: Ca ka hakowa ko kafana’an no mako, ano ira ko kafana’an no mako pacako han to ako kiso.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: O sapi’adop namo a talakal iraay ko kapaysinan haw?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: O sapi’adop niyam a talakal, tatiih ko fafahiyan a mitefing.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: Nga’ay ko fafahiyan mitoor a mi’adop haw?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: Cowa kanga’ay, tatiih ko fafahiyan a mi’adop.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Kacaw, awaay to ko miciw i loma’, mi’aca ho to miciw.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Kacaw, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: Iraay ho i cawka ko cecay a talid, hamanay to a mi’aca!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: Cango’ot ko cecay a talid, tosaen a talid ko ni’acaan.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: Mami’aca kako to miciw, paliwalay kamo haw?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: Iraay! Pina ko ’a’acaen no miso?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: Tosa a talid ko ’a’acaen no mako, mi’aca ho kako to felac cecay a tafo.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: Ini ko felac, o maan ho ko ’a’acaen iso?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: Mami’aca ho kako to fita’ol, iraay haw?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: Maeminay to a mapaliwal ko fita’ol niyam.
Mami’aca kako to riko’.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: Masamaanay ko ’a’acaen no miso?
S.TRANSL: What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: O kamoko’ay ko caca’edongan a riko’ ko ’a’acaen no mako.
S.TRANSL: ant to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: Onini kahengangay makena?
Iraay ko roma a cengel haw?
Iraay ho ko kohecalay ato langdaway.
S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: Pafelien kako to cecay langdaway a riko’.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Kacaw, talacowaay kiso i sawni? Miontoay kiso haw?
S.TRANSL: Kacaw你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Kacaw, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: Cowa, patadoay kako to fofoan a mi’aca to dateng.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: Hay han, ira ko romi’ad iso to dadaya haw? Malacafay kita a malafi ano dadaya, makahi kiso?
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: Ca kanga’ay, o mami’aca to riko’ kako.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: Ano hatira, tooren ako kiso.
S.TRANSL: Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: Nga’ay ho! Pinaay ko ’aca nona dateng?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: Tosa polo’ ko ’aca nona dateng to cecay a rorong.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: Pina ko ’aca nona konga?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: Tolo polo’ ko ’aca nona konga to cecay a tingting.
S.TRANSL: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: Pafelien kako to tosa rorong a dateng cecay tingting a konga.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Kacaw, matawalay ako miala ko impac, nga’ay pacaliwen kako haw?
S.TRANSL: Kacaw，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Kacaw, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: Awaay ko no mako, o ni Panay konini.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is Panay’s.

S.FORM: Nga’ay pacaliwen ho kako haw? Halikien to ako a patikol kiso.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: Hayda, na alaen.
Ahowiday, patadoen to kako a miahowiday ci Panay haw!
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Panay for me.

S.FORM: O maan ho ko sasaalien iso?
O papatikol kako tona tosa a tilid.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: Hayda, o maan ho ko sasaalien iso?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: O mamicalw ho kako tona tolo a tilid.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: Hayda, haratengen to tolo a romi’ad patikolen a patayni. yo.
S.TRANSL: 好了。記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: Cowa ho patikol kiso to sasipasip ako.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: Mapatikolay to ako inacila.
Mana awa a ma’araw koya sasipasip no mako.
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: Pacaliwan iso ci Kacaw han?
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Kacaw?

S.FORM: Hayken, licayen ho ako cira.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: Pacaliw han ho ako kiso to sasipasip ako.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Panay, o nipacaliwan ni Kacaw tisowanan koni a kayto haw?
S.TRANSL: Panay, did Kacaw lend you this coat?

S.FORM: Cowa, o ni’acaan no wina ako to hamako konini.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: Mahecaday ko kayto ni Kacaw to no miso.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: O kohetingay ko kayto nira, cowa kahlalecad ko cengel niyam.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Panay, micaliwan iso ko payci ni Kacaw haw?
S.TRANSL: Panay, did you borrow money from Kacaw?

S.FORM: Hai, o papatikolen no mako cira anini, matawalay no mako a mihawikid ko payci.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

S.FORM: Hacowa a patikolen no miso?
S.TRANSL: Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: Anocila hanto ako a patikol cira.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: Hayda, sowal hanto ako ci Kacaw.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Kacaw for you.

S.FORM: O fakeloh ko sapi’enec to ’edo a mi’adop, o wa’il ko sapitalakal to tolok, matatodongay haenen.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: Mahaenay han, mararaway ko demak ako! Salaw awa ko ma’adpay no mako.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: Pakafana’en ho ako kiso misanga’ tona tosa a satalakal.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: Hayda! Tadanga’ayay to! Ano miliyaw mi’adop haenen to ako a mitalakal nga’ citama’.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: Alaen ko kawkaw i kofaw, tayra kita i omah mifariw to semot, ’akawangay to ko semot i omah.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: Icowaan miteli ko kawkaw?
Itiraay i fati’ian no tanomal, comod sa kiso ma’araw to.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: Na’onen miala, cihinangay ko kawkaw kiya!
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利！
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: Aka ripa’en ko talakal ako!
Icowaan iso miteli ko talakal iso?
I kaeno nora kilang ko talakal no mako.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: Mana maharateng iso?
Ira ko nikonisan ako ini, mansa mafana’ to kako, icowaan ako miteli ko talakal ako.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: O foefo koni, telien niyam i lawac no ’alo a mifoting.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: Awaay ko foefo tamiyanan, pacemot hananay ko pifoting i tamiyanan.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: Ca ho pitanam kako a mipacemot, cila to pakafana’ han to kako makena?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: Hayda, cila to lacafay sato kita a mipacemot.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: Liyaw to a romi’ad pakafana’ han to ako kiso a misanga’ to foefo.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: Tatemikay to ko sapacemot iso, mapacemotay to ko foting alatek, halikien a mitengteng.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: Aka ho, ngiyangi sanay ko tamina. Itini sa kako mitengteng to sapacemot, patadoen ho kako miala to salil itira.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: Tengtengen patayni kora foting, patadoen no mako kiso a mitengteng.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: Wata! Makadofah anini, tomes sanay ko faroro.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: Halikien a minokay palilamen no mita ko salawinawina.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: Iraay to ko singsi.
Aka to pisalama, Kamaro’ to i hakenang.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: Kangodo’an, masosoyay kako!
Micomod to.
O sakapina no mitiliday anini?
O sakalima, Pahanhan anocila, malacafay kita a misalama!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: Hayda! Tala’alo kita.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

S.FORM: O sakapina no mitiliday anocila?
S.TRANSL: What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: O sakatolo anocila, Misalama kita to mali anocila to ikor no kalahokan!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: Mimaan kiso anopapacem?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: O pa’aliwacan anocila, O tatayra kako ato ina ako i kiwkay.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: Mamaanay kiso?
Saka’otaaw sanay kako, Tayra ho kako i tata’iyan.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: Lasang sanay ko fongoh ako.
Hinefa sa ho kiso a pahanhan.
Singsi, adadaay ko tiyad ako, Tayra ho kako i tata’iyan.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: Hayda, halikien a tayra.
Nga’ay a misawsaw kako to kamay haw?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: Papahanhan to, anohoni to a tayra.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: Singsi, adada sanay ko fongoh ako, Pahanhan kako i ikor no kalahokan.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: Hayda, na’onen ko rakat a minokay.
S.TRANSL: Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: Singsi, papahanhan kako anocila sakacecay no mitiliday, O papaising kako.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: Hayda, Sanga’ayen to ko tireng.
Icowaay ci Panay?
Adadaay ko tiyad nira, Itiraay i tata’iyen cira.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: Icowaay ci Kacaw?
Singsi, adadaay ko takolaw ni Kacaw, Pahanhanay anini.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Kacaw has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: Mana awa ci Panay?
Malalisanay cira.
Siwkayen ho ko tireng iso.
Si Caki kako, Moetepay to ko mihecaan ako.
S.TRANSL: My name is Caki, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: Cima ko ngangan no miso?
Si Caki ko ngangan no mako.
O maan ko finacadan no miso?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: O wawa no ’Amis kako.
Saheto o Yencomin ko paro no loma’ namo haw?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: Hai, saheto o ’Amis ko paro no loma’ niyam.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是阿美族人。
Yes, my whole family is Amis.

S.FORM: Saheto o ’Amis ko paro no loma’ iso haw?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: Cowa, o wama ako i, o ’Amis; o ina ako i, o Payrang.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是阿美族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Amis, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: Nima a wawa kiso?
O wawa ni Mayaw Lahok kako.
O ama iso kora haw? Pinaay to ko mihecaan nira?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: Enem polo’ ko mihecaan nira.
O ama iso kora haw? Pinaay to ko mihecaan nira?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: Cowa, o kalas no niyaro’ cira, falo polo’ to ko mihecaan nira.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: Pina to ko mihecaan no kaka iso to fa’inayan?
Moetep ira ko falo ko mihecaan no kaka ako.
Adihayay ko kaikaka no mihecaan no kaka iso tisowanan haw?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: Lima a mihecaan ko kalala’ed no mihecaan niyam.
Hakowaay ko ’akawang iso?
Cecay so’ot ira ko sepat polo’ a kongfen ko ’akawang ako.
Halafin to caay kasaso’araw, ’akawangay to kiso haw?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: Hai, Cecay so’ot ira ko tolo polo’ ko ’akawang ako.
Maso^soay kiso haw?
Cowa, mararaway ko pinengneng iso.
Mangiliway kiso haw?
Cowa, maso^soay kako.
Maso^soay kiso haw?
Hai, tolo polo’ to ko tingting ako.
Tatalacowa kiso?
Tatayra i katayalan no singsi mikilim to singsi.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: Tatalacowa ci Kacaw?
Mamifalah ko mira to lakaw.
S.TRANSL: He's going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: Icowaay ci Kacaw?
Itira i pidangoyan ko mira, o mamilifet cira a midangoy anohoni.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He's at the swimming pool. He's going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: Icowaay ci Panay? O mamilifet cira a comikay anohoni.
S.TRANSL: Panay在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Panay? She's going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: Itiraay i Li-tang cira, pohayen ako cira.
S.TRANSL: She's in the auditorium. I'll go call her.

S.FORM: Ta talakacomikayan kita.
S.TRANSL: Let's go to the playground together.

S.FORM: Mi’aca ho kako to sakalahok, anosoni kilimen ako kiso.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I'll go buy lunch first, and then I'll meet you later.

S.FORM: Malacafay kita mikakoy to patafoan!
S.TRANSL: Let's carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: Kilimen ko tao, o mamikilim ho kako to singsi.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I'm going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: O mamilifet ci Kacaw to mimaliay to coy-ciw haw?
S.TRANSL: Is Kacaw competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: Cowa, o mamilifet ko mira to miterocay.
S.TRANSL: No, he's competing in high jump.

S.FORM: O mamilifet kiso toya piongtokayan haw?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: Hay, O cacomikay kako.
O mamilifet kiso toya piontokayan haw?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: O mamimali kako to coy-ciw.
O mamimaan kita toya piongtokayan?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: O mamilifet kita to milatengtengay.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: O papaliwal kita to kakaenen toya piontokayan haw?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: Cowa, o papaliwal kita to sifaliay a mali.
Sakacecay ko ngangan iso yo, idahiyay to!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You're amazing!

S.FORM: Ahowiday!
Iraay i loma’ ko fofo haw?
Iraay, mafoti’ay cira i kafoti’an.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: Iraay i loma’ ko fofo haw?
Awaay, mahadakay cira, dadaya nga, minokayay.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: Iraay i loma’ ko akong haw?
Iraay i kafekang o sakarosa a tingroh, kilimen cira.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: Iraay ko tamdaw i loma’ haw?
Ci Kacaw ha! Halafin to cowa ka’araw kiso. Nga’ayay ho ko miso?
S.TRANSL: 是Kacaw阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Kacaw. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: Nga’ayay! Malaholol ho kita sa kako.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: Icowaay ko ama iso?
xIcowaay ko ama iso?
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: Talacowaay ci Panay?
Micepetay cira to koko’ i pakoko’an.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: Akong, tayniay to kami.
Awaay i loma’ ko akong namo, itiraay i omah cira. i loma’ sa ho kamo a mitala ciraan.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: Faki, iraay to kiso!
Halafin to cowa ka’araw kiso, ’akawangay to kiso.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: Mahemek ko faloco’ to katayni iso.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: O papafelien kamo tona onglay, pingsyangen.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: Halafin sa, awa ho a tayni, pohayen ho ako cangra a mapolong a malahok.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: Hapimaan, ocya sa ko nananomen ako, itira kita i palafangan a malaholoholol.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: Ahowiday to pihamham iso. Minokay to kako.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: Maherekay to a mili’opih koni koko’, panokayen cedeng han iso a komaen.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: Matatatek kita to cikang, to herek no lahok anocila, nga’ay haw?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: Nga’ay to. Icowa kita a masaso’araw?
I kongkoan kita, nga’ay haw? O mamiloing kita.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: Ano hatira i, tayra kita i sefi. Sicaedong kako.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: Makapahay ko sakora a hana no niyaro’. Yo macelak ko hana i, kilimen kako haw!
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: Tahira i kacanglahan, maosoyay tato!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

S.FORM: Ano hatira i, i kiloma’an kiso a tayni!
S.TRANSL: 那你豐年祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!

S.FORM: Hayda! Hinatala ko faloco’ ako!
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: Mana malinah a minokay kiso i niyaro’ a maro’?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: Minokay pakafana’ kako to tilid.
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: Mana cowa kaitokay a pakafana’?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: Naw han i, ma’ololay kako to niyaro’ ako, miharateng haca paco’ay to niyaro’.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: Mafana’ kiso a mitenooy, cima ko pakfana’ay i tisowanan?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: O fofo ako. O samafana’ay a mitenooy i niyaro’ cira.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: Mana miharateng a minanam a mitenooy kiso?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: O serangawan ita ko tenooy, sapipatenakaw kako to serangawan ita.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: Sanga’ay sa a nanomen kona epah.
Kako ko misaepahay yo!
Tadaidahiyay to kiso, halafinay a misanga’ tona epah haw?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: Cowa kahalafin. Maedeng cecay a lipay nga’ayay to. Rahekaden ho ko doway ato felac, palamlamen to otong a mitiyol nga, nga’ayay to a paroen i koreng.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: O maan ko mipaliwalan iso?
Ira ko ’adiyamay ato lokiw. Saheto o mipalomaan ako yo!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: Tosa ko mi’acaan, pina ko ’aca?
Tosa so’ot lima polo’ ira ko lima a limood.
Maolah kako tona riko’, pina ko ’aca nira?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: Lima so’ot a limood koni a riko’.
’Atekakay, cowa kanga’ay a lowanen to mamang haw?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: Cowa kanga’ay, ano lowanen i, masiponay kako.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: Hayda, ora kohetingay ko ’a’acaen ako.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: Mi’aca kako toni po’ot ato inian a dangah.
S.TRANSL: 我要買這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: Polong han tosa lefot a limood. O misanga’an ako koni, o hahalafin a sakadademak.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: Siwkayen ako ko widang a mi’aca, nga’ay kaemeden to mamang haw?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: Hayda! Papiteken ako to falo ko ’aca.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: Katayni a minengneng! Ira ko riko’ ato kafong itini.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: Licayaw ho, pinaay ko ’aca noni riko’?
Tolo so’ot lima polo’ ko ’aca no cecay, hatolo han i, molefot ko ’aca.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: Cecay aca ko mi’acaan ako, pafelien kako to faelohay.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: Nga’ay ho, mi’aca kako to hakhak ato siimocay a titi.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: Maeminay to ko hemay. Iraay ho ko sitana’ay a yu-ping, mi’aca kiso?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: Hayda! Pafelien kako to cecay, cila to nga, mi’aca kako to hemay.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: Hay, padangen ako kiso a miparo i kalasay. Lima polo’ a limood ko ’aca.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
